proof:
Proof. By Lemmas 33, and 34, whp all vertex sets in $G$ with size at least $\ge \eta n$ have average degree is at least $3d/4$. Also by the second part of the first Lemma, whp, for any vertex set $S \subseteq V_G$ with size between $\eta n$ and $(1-\eta)n$, $|E_G(S, \bar{S})| \ge \frac{5d}{6}|S|(n-|S|)$. Also whp $n_C \ge (1-e^{-d/3})n$. Assume further on $G$ satisfies these properties.

Also by the choice of $\eta$ and by Lemma 12, whp $G$ is such that for any $F \in \Omega_C^{\mathrm{ord}}$, there is a giant component in $(V_C, F)$ with total degree $\ge \frac{9}{10} \mathrm{deg}_G(V_C)$. Thus the set $S$ of vertices in the non-giant components has total degree $\le \frac{1}{10} \mathrm{deg}_G(V_C)$. Note that all edges in $E_G(S, \bar{S})$ are in $E_C \setminus F$. We consider three cases, based on the size of $S$.

If $|S| \ge \frac{\eta n}{3}$, then $\mathrm{deg}_G(S) \ge \frac{3d}{4}\frac{\eta n}{3}$. But also $\mathrm{deg}_G(S) \le \frac{\mathrm{deg}_G(V_C)}{10} \le \frac{dn}{10}+o(n)$, which is a contradiction.

Next consider the case $\eta n \le |S| \le \frac{n}{3}$. Then $|E_C \setminus F| \ge |E_G(S, \bar{S})| \ge \frac{5\eta nd}{9}$. However, since $S$ acts as a vertex cut in the graph, by Menger's Theorem the size of the edge cut $E_G(S, \bar{S})$ is bounded by the size of the vertex set, so $|E_G(S, \bar{S})| \le |S| \le n/3$. This implies $\frac{5\eta nd}{9} \le n/3$, which is a contradiction for large $d$.

Thus the only remaining possibility is $|S| \le \eta n$. Then $c(F) \le |S| \le \eta n + 1$ and $|F| \le |E_C| \le nd/2 + \eta n$ (the last inequality holds whp). Thus we obtain that $w_C(F) \le q^{\eta n+1}(e^\beta-1)^{nd/2+\eta n} < q^{\eta n+2-1/10 \cdot nd + \eta n} = q^{n[1-1/20+2\eta]}$.

Since $\emptyset$ is a configuration with a weight $q^{n_C} > q^{n(1-e^{-d/3})}$, it follows that $Z_C > q^{n-ne^{-d/3}}$. There are at most $2^{|E_C|} = 2^{nd/2+\eta n}$ ordered configurations, therefore,
$$ \frac{Z_C^{\mathrm{dis}}}{Z_C} \le 2^{nd/2+\eta n} q^{n[-1+1-1/10+2\eta+e^{-d/3}]} = \exp\{n[d\ln 2/2 + \log q(-1/10 + 2\eta + e^{-d/3})]\}. $$
Since $1/10 - 2\eta - e^{-d/3} > 1/20$ for all $d$ large enough, this becomes $\exp\{nd \ln 2/2 - n \log q/20\}$, which is $\le e^{-n}$ for all $q$ large enough.
